Dear Gordon.
I recently commited a bug #1675749 ARCWriter cannot handle rec=
ords larger than 2 GB
https://sourceforge.net/tracker/?func=3Ddetail&atid=
=3D539099&aid=3D1675749&group_id=3D73833

The reason is of course, that rec=
ordlength in the ARCWriter.write() methods is given as an integer value

I =
noticed also, that in the equivalent method in the ExperimentalWARCWriter (=
writeRecord), the recordlength is given as a long value.
Is this bug not ea=
sy to fix?

---------------------------------------------------------------=
------------
S=F8ren Vejrup Carlsen, Department of Digital Preservation, Ro=
yal Library, Copenhagen, Denmark
tlf: (+45) 33 47 48 41
email: svc@...
--=
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
=
Non omnia possumus omnes
--- Macrobius, Saturnalia, VI, 1, 35 -------


---=
--Original Message-----
From: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com@KB On Behalf =
Of Gordon Mohr
<gojomo@...>
Sent: Tuesday, March 13, 2007 12:00 AM
=
To: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [archive-crawler] Heritrix 1.1=
2.0 Release Candidate


A release candidate build for the upcoming Heritrix=
 1.12.0 release is 
now available from the Heritrix build box, 
<http://bui=
lds.archive.org:8080/cruisecontrol/buildresults/HEAD-heritrix>.

Specifical=
ly, build #116 -- "heritrix-1.11.0-200703122120" -- is 
considered public R=
elease Candidate 1 and may be downloaded here:

http://builds.archive.org:8=
080/cruisecontrol/artifacts/HEAD-heritrix/20070312212008/

Draft release no=
tes are available here:

http://webteam.archive.org/confluence/display/Heri=
trix/Release+Notes+-+1.12.0

If you have the chance, please give this code =
a try with your typical 
configurations and let us know of any issues that =
should be addressed in 
release notes or with urgent fixes.

Heritrix SVN H=
EAD is frozen against code commits, except for 
documentation issues and an=
y critical issues which surface in the next 
couple of days.

Two process n=
otes associated with this upcoming release:

* Project bug/issue tracking h=
as migrated from Sourceforge to 
<http://webteam.archive.org/jira/browse/HE=
R>, a JIRA-based system.

* The project wiki is gradually migrating from a =
UseMod-based wiki at 
crawler.archive.org to a Confluence wiki at 
<http://=
webteam.archive.org/confluence/display/Heritrix>.

If you register to repor=
t/comment on JIRA issues, the same login will 
work for wiki edits.

- Gord=
on @ IA
